title: Master Drive - 3D Multiplayer Driving Simulator
description: Master Drive is an online multiplayer driving simulator which aims to create a realistic driving simulation game for students to play and learn, and improve studentâ€™s traffic safety awareness and cultivate social responsibility. In Master Drive, other than operating a realistic vehicle, players have to obey the road laws while gaining points by driving towards a random generated zone.
content: Major framework contructed with MVVM strucutre
Responsible for game framework, player character, UI and HUD development

title: Study War - 2D Rougelike game
description: The key concept of Study War is to create a challenging and replayable experience that combines traditional roguelike game mechanics with retro-style pixel graphics. This includes designing the game with procedural generation, permanent death, resource management, exploration and discovery, and pixel art style features. Procedural generation is an important aspect of gameplay, as it generates random levels, enemies, props and other game elements to keep the gameplay fresh and engaging. This ensures that each game session is unique and challenging for the player. Permadeath is another important gameplay mechanic that creates high-stakes gameplay and encourages players to learn from their mistakes and improve their skills. This also adds to the replayability of the game as players will want to keep trying to go deeper into the dungeon or unlock more different weapons and monsters. Resource management requires players to carefully manage their resources and decide to enter all rooms to gain more currency or enter fewer rooms to maintain a healthy blood level. This can add a strategic aspect to the gameplay. Exploration and discovery are also essential, as they encourage players to explore and discover new areas, enemies, and props. This can generate new strategies and possibilities to help players advance further in the game. In short, the key concept of Study War is to create a challenging and immersive experience that encourages players to experiment, explore and improve their skills while combining classic roguelike gameplay mechanics with retro-style graphics.
content: Designed the algorithm for random map generation
Responsible for game framework, player character, game environment and UI development

title: Library Management System
description: This library admin system allows uer to add, edit and delete books record, user can also modify book status such as 'borrow', 'return' and 'reserve'. Advanced feature like title search and sorting by ISBN or title are also supported.
content: Group project, teamming with another student

title: Online Broadcast System
description: In this project, our team implemented a video monitoring system, which allows user to broadcast his/her live video footage to other user for monitoring through standard Web browser. Other than that, our team also implemented some advanced features such as viewer counter, video recording, motion detection and face tracking.
content: Group project, teamming with another student
